locutie.beschrijving: The preacher narrates the post-resurrection appearance of Jesus to the disciples behind locked doors, focusing on four specific utterances: Peace, Sending, Spirit, and Forgiveness.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher moves from the historical 'then' of the text to the theological 'now' of the congregation.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher attempts to mediate the voice of Jesus. The force shifts from describing Jesus' speech acts to re-performing them for the hearer.
voorbeelden: Jesus says to you: Peace be with you.
I give you this word from Jesus: you are sent.
The wind of God is promised to us.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The transformation of fear into courage; the movement from 'hiding' to 'mission'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicit. Section III is dedicated entirely to the Holy Spirit as the power that enables the perlocutionary effect.

voorbeelden: The story is not about shut doors.
You need never be the same again.
Each of us must rethink this sending.
It is a good thing Jesus gave that promise.
The wind of God is promised to us.
These four words are for you.
Jesus has taken over the shape of your life.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong. The preacher uses the biblical promises to bind God to the current congregation.

voorbeelden: No longer operative, no longer true!
declaratieven.autoriteit: High. The preacher speaks as a mandatory, declaring a new reality based on the resurrection.

indicatoren: The descriptive parts serve as 'stage setting' for the address.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Provides necessary context for the encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct absolution ('I forgive you') is replaced by a description of the church's power to forgive.

voorbeelden: The wind of God is promised to us.
These four words are for you.
toezegging_check.moment_in_preek: Distributed throughout each of the four points.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used to establish the preacher's voice ('I give you this word').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: High frequency of 'you' and 'your', creating direct address.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the promises of Jesus directly to the listener.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Used for the biblical narrative and general theological truths.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Minimal, as it quickly pivots to the second person.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of peace and spirit.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the narrative (Assertive) to the promise (Commissive) to the call (Directive).
voorbeelden: Jesus said 'Peace' (Assertive) -> This word is for you (Commissive) -> Rethink your sending (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent integration of the indicative and imperative.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: If you want the peace of Jesus, then you must accept the sending of Jesus.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as an event where the words of Jesus are not just discussed but re-spoken into the present situation of the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: On this Pentecost day, here are four words for you.
sterke_punten.effect: Breaks the distance between text and hearer.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The news is not just that God forgives, but that God has created a people...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Stays slightly constative regarding forgiveness rather than performing an act of absolution.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The preacher successfully uses 'creative speaking' to make the locked room of the text the locked room of the hearer.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The sermon acts as a means of grace by 'handing over' the promises.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, the preacher explicitly states Jesus is the one speaking.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, 'I give you this word from Jesus'.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the power that blows beyond ourselves.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the Spirit is the one who makes the 'miracle' happen.
tekstueel_bewijs: You are subject to the power of God that will move you.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the words are described as things that 'can never be unsaid'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Jesus who says the word brings the reality of what he says.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is well-balanced, avoiding the 'constative surplus' common in academic preaching.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The news is that God forgives.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of Jesus, your sins are forgiven.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from an Assertive (fact) to a Declarative (event).

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the current use of 'this word is for you'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a model of how to use Speech Act principles to turn a biblical narrative into a contemporary encounter with the Risen Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or the 'relationship' between preacher and hearer, this analysis shows the sermon functions as a divine mandate where the preacher's person disappears behind the 'magisterial speech' of Jesus.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the metaphors (rhetoric) but in the illocutionary force of the promise (SAT).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the 'Peace' section is not just a greeting but a 'world-creating' declarative act.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'lecture trap' by consistently pivoting from the third person to the second person.
